intro: Caiophora chuquitensis, commonly known as the Chuquitensis Caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
